title: Ticket #6764: TCP_FORWARDING_HOST vs PRIVATE_NETWORK_*
description:
The following five-line configuration does not result in an advertised private network (name or interface/address): 

USE_SHARED_PORT = FALSE
# This line may be superfluous / redundant
NETWORK_INTERFACE = $(IP_ADDRESS)
PRIVATE_NETWORK_NAME = tannenba
PRIVATE_NETWORK_INTERFACE = $(IP_ADDRESS)
TCP_FORWARDING_HOST = 1.2.3.4

It appears that DaemonCore::InfoCommandSinfulStringMyself() has a bug where TCP_FORWARDING_HOST changes the public IP of the sinful /after/ the determination of whether to advertise the private network attributes (we don't if the public and private sinfuls aren't different).

This problem doesn't happen when USE_SHARED_PORT is TRUE (the default), which probably means that the above test is probably broken.
remarks:
2018-Sep-14 18:37:58 by tlmiller:
After further investigation, this may have been a testing problem. We deliberately don't set TCP_FORWARDING_HOST in the .address files, because those are intended only for local communication. So, using the test configuration: 

$ condor_status -master -af MyAddress
<1.2.3.4:32845?PrivAddr=%3c69.130.241.97:32845%3e&PrivNet=tannenba&addrs=1.2.3.4-32845&noUDP>
$ cat ../install/local/log/.master_address
<69.130.241.97:32845?addrs=69.130.241.97-32845>
$CondorVersion: 8.7.10 Sep 14 2018 BuildID: UW_development PRE-RELEASE-UWCS $
$CondorPlatform: X86_64-Debian_7 $

You see that without shared port, the address file uses the specified NETWORK_INTERFACE. The address file does not include the private network name, which make no sense for local communication, but the actual advertised Sinful does. (Arguably, you could have a private network address that you'd rather use for local communication, but since we don't support that, using the specified NETWORK_INTERFACE is the most likely to result in locally-routed packets, since the kernel must know about that interface for anything else to work.)

With shared port: 

$ condor_status -master -af MyAddress
<1.2.3.4:40095?PrivAddr=%3c69.130.241.97:40095%3fsock%3d29510_4c4b%3e&PrivNet=tannenba&addrs=1.2.3.4-40095&noUDP&sock=29510_4c4b>
$ cat ../install/local/log/.master_address
<1.2.3.4:40095?PrivAddr=%3c69.130.241.97:40095%3fsock%3d29510_4c4b%3e&PrivNet=tannenba&addrs=1.2.3.4-40095&noUDP&sock=29510_4c4b>
$CondorVersion: 8.7.10 Sep 14 2018 BuildID: UW_development PRE-RELEASE-UWCS $
$CondorPlatform: X86_64-Debian_7 $

You can see that the address file uses the same address as the advertised address, because it's using (must use) the shared port's address. Arguably, the on-disk shared port ad should include what would otherwise be in its .address file, but that's not what we do for whatever reason.

2018-Sep-17 13:34:42 by tlmiller:
Resolving since we can't reproduce. Best guess is that ToddT forgot to restart the shared port daemon after making the changes.
